name: stereophonic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
recording or playing sound in a way that separates it into two signals and produces more natural sound, or relating to this kind of sound: With the advent of stereophonic LPs, Bernstein became one of the most recorded classical musicians in the world. Stereophonic recording was developed to give the listener the ambience of a concert hall. Synonym
stereo Related words
stereophonically
stereophony
More examplesFewer examplesStereophonic sound was developed for use in theatres in the 1930s.Many of the studios of the major American companies had been rebuilt to accommodate the introduction of stereophonic sound.As in stereophonic sound systems, the use of two or more microphones enables the source of the sound to be located.
